A '''gristmill''' or '''grist mill''', otherwise known as a '''flourmill''' or '''grainmill''',
document_data.Description:
The cereal grains that were ground up in gristmills included such crops as [[barley]],{{ Cite book/Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting 2nd edition (revised)/Shadowdale|16}} [[wheat]],

Mills operated by having farmers pay their operator, known as a "miller," a percentage of their ground grains in return for the use of their mill. Across the [[Dragon Reach]] and [[Sword Coast]], most millers charged one bag for every seven, though some took only one for every eight bags when dealing with long-standing customers. In [[the Dalelands]], local lords made sure that the mills in their land operated at a fair price.<ref><ref>

Types of Mills.Magicmill: The most atypical type of mill, these were powered by various [[magic]]al means and usually created when no other motive force was an option. This could include such things as millstones powered by [[golem]]s or stones enspelled with a [[permanency|permanent]] ''[[animate object]]'' effect. These were most commonly found in [[Halruaa]] and [[Thay]].
Types of Mills.Watermill: Mills whose millstones were moved by waterwheels, which turned by means of water passing beneath it or flowing over its top. This usually required the mill to be located at a waterfall or river, though some managed to run off a diverted flow from nearby rivers.
Types of Mills.Wheelmill: Mills whose millstones were powered by means of [[human]]s (typically slaves) or [[animal]]s, which dragged or pushed large beams affixed to the upper stone.{{Cite dragon/304/Elminster's Guide to the Realms: Jongrath's Mill|78}} or [[oxen]]. The limitations of living motive forces restricted this type of mill to small operations.
Types of Mills.Windmill: Mills whose millstones were powered similarly to waterwheels, but by means of wind catching in great vanes. These were typically found in areas with strong and steady breezes, such as along coastlines.

document_data.Notable Mills:
[[File:JongrathMill-wide.jpg|thumb|275px|''An overview of [[Ilmurk Jongrath]]'s horse-driven wheelmill as an example.'']]
* [[Chasler Belvrost]] owned a flourmill along the [[River Reddan]].<ref>
* [[Deltar's Mill]], a haunted gristmill in [[Eveningstar]] operated by [[Deltar Tummarlin]].
* The [[Daggerford/Farmlands|Eastern Farmlands]] of [[Daggerford]] had a gristmill that acted as one of the major sources of food for the town. Outside of the farmlands, there were three grainmills owned by businesswoman [[Bess Miller]].
* The village of [[Ghars]] had a grist mill that was driven by oxen.
* [[The Grainhouse]], an ancient granary in the town of [[Purskul]] that doubled as a watermill.<ref>
* [[Heward's Mill]], a gristmill in [[Archenbridge]] that was operated by [[Salath Heward]].
* [[Jongrath's Mill]], a gristmill in [[Tethyr]] that was driven by horses.
* [[Julkoun's Old Mill]], a mill in the village of [[Julkoun]].
* [[Mirrorman's Mill]], a mill in the town of [[Shadowdale]].{{ Cite book/Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting 2nd edition (revised)/Shadowdale|15}}
* The village of [[Noktil]] had several watermills that were powered by the [[Immerflow]] river.<ref>{{ Cite book/Cormyr|28}}
* In the nation of [[Ra-Khati]], some mountaintop [[monasteries]] had grainmills that were powered with the help of massive wooden [[pulley]]s,<ref> such as the [[Rainbow Monastery]].
* [[Thorm's Mill]], the sole gristmill in all of [[Ashabenford]].
* The village of [[Womford]] had a gristmill along the banks of the [[Dessarin River]].<ref>
* [[Woumar's Wheloon Mill]], a  gristmill in [[Wheloon]] operated by [[Leahon Woumar]].
